mdRecord.dcterms:description: Text printed in two columns and signed, in print, at end: Meriwether Smith.
Smith defends himself against "scandalous and unjust" charges accusing him of official misconduct as a member of the Privy Council, where he served from November 1776 through May of 1777.

Publication details are based on the bookseller's statement that the sheet was originally discovered bound with a set of Alexander Purdie's Virginia Gazette, 1776-1777, and that the type is identical to the type used in other publications by Purdie.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Tracy W. McGregor Library, American History Collection. McGregor Endowment Fund, 2007/2008. The bookseller's description is housed in folder with the text.
